greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0, and for n > 1, if A079559(n) = 0, then a(n) = 1 + a(A234017(n)), otherwise a(n) = a(A213714(n)-1).
comment: a(n) tells how many terms of A055938 are encountered when traversing toward the root of binary tree A233276, starting from the node containing n. This count includes also n in case it itself is a term of A055938. See also comments in A256478 and A256991.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: a(1) = 0, and for n > 1, if A079559(n) = 0, then a(n) = 1 + a(A234017(n)), otherwise a(n) = a(A213714(n)-1).
a(n) = A080791(A233277(n)). [Number of nonleading zeros in the binary representation of A233277(n).]
xref: Cf. also A000225 (gives the positions zeros).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 15 2015
